results.title: People soup
results.creator_credit: Marc Merson, Learning Corporation of America, Pangloss Productions and Alan Arkin
results.brief_description: This charming fantasy of two young brothers and the messy green concoction which transforms them for a moment into a chicken and a large sheepdog is presented with a child’s wide-eyed trust and conviction. Their conversation concerning ingredients and their coming to terms for participation in the experiment are hilarious. Written and directed by noted film-maker and actor, Alan Arkin, and using his two sons as actors.

results.title: People people
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage excellence for people involved in customer service. It demonstrates how people in customer service can derive great personal satisfaction in their work by taking positive professional attitude to the people they are serving. Useful in the commerce frameworks area of Business Studies for Years 9 and 10. Also a valuable video for briefing students undergoing work experience in customer service related industry.

results.title: People over the Plenty
results.brief_description: The film follows the reconstruction of the Greensborough footbridge after the original cable suspension bridge was swept away in the River Plenty floods of 1974. The Shire of Diamond Valley contracted B.C.S. Consulting Engineers and Surveyors and Gibbs Bright & Co, timber suppliers to rebuild the bridge. The Greensborough Bridge is unique in that it is the first structure of its kind to be made of pine, is the longest footbridge in Australia and was aesthetically designed to blend in perfect harmony with its rural surroundings.

results.title: People out of time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A study of the Bindubi tribe, Australian aborigines who have mastered their arid, inhospitable environment in the Great Sandy Desert by using every resource to the maximum point of refinement. Filmed on Professor Donald Thompson’s 1963 expedition. Narrated by Leo McKern, filmed by David Corke and Len McLarty, written and presented by Eric Davidson.

results.title: People of Venice
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Gunther V. Fritsch
results.brief_description: A film of contrasts: a workingman’s family living today against the magnificent background of Venice’s past. Tony Biasi and one of his sons repair the big diesel boats that transport passengers on the canals. Sergio, another son of school age, enjoys the everyday life of a Venetian boy, helping a friend transport vegetables, rowing on the canals, and helping with family chores.

results.title: People of the Waikato
results.brief_description: A description of the Waikato River in New Zealand’s North Island and Lake Taupo, its main source. Includes views of waterfalls and rapids, hot springs, and geysers in Waikato thermal valley and hydroelectric schemes.

results.title: People of the rock
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tim Wilson, Nicholas Balla and Clarke Da Prato
results.brief_description: This film follows an Inuit family’s journey to the North Rankin nickel mine. How the hunters became bulldozer and machine operators is explained. Music by Robert Fleming.

results.title: People of the reindeer = The Wind from the west
results.brief_description: Portrays he lives and superstitions of the Lapps. In the spring the reindeer herds go north, tended by all family except elders and school children. Young Nils however, wooed by the voice of the West Wind, escapes the schoolroom in a day dream and experiences the adventures of which all Lapp boys dream. This film is a re-edit of an earlier film “Wind from the West” [012005].
